titleStmt.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1825 Oct. 24 : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1825 Oct. 24
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt is from the Monday October 24, 1825 session of court, during which a series of both civil and criminal cases were heard. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.head: Monday 24
div.p: Court convened agreeable to adjournment

Present their Honors John Martin
&C et cetera
Jurors George Saunders, Foreman.

Nancy Miller
Ptf Plaintiff
vs
Jessee E Bean
Dft Defendant
a plea for horses
Continued

Betsey Walker Ptf
vs
Culsowe & others Dfts
a plea for a Mare Colt
Continued

Salley West Ptf
vs
John Walker senr senior
Dft
The right for a negroe negro girl Named Quate
Continued

Thomas Fields Ptf
vs
John Miller Dft
Violating the Cherokee law
It is the opinion of the Court that the defendant be fined $5_00.

Thomas Fields Ptf
vs
John Miller Dft
violating the Cherokee law
Acquitted.
Court is adjourned untill until tomorrow 10 Oclock
Present their Honors J Martin, &C Jurors G. Saunders
